item.title: Dollar Boosted by Strong US Jobs Data
item.description: The dollar rose following the jobs data, as strong employment growth will “keep pressure on the Fed to keep raising rates,” although a higher unemployment rate and slightly slower wage growth could lead to a slower pace of rate rises and potentially a pause in June, MUFG said.

item.title: Greek-German Bond Yield Spread Could Tighten Further
item.description: Greek government bonds had a decent run tightening versus German bonds as well as other peripheral peers since 2022 but a series of short-term indicators hint there may be space for another 20 basis points, Bank of America said.

item.title: Rio Tinto Shares Are Undervalued
item.description: Rio Tinto shares are down more than 20% year-to-date, making them attractively undervalued given the company’s high quality, cash generative business, Deutsche Bank said, lifting its rating to buy and its target price to 6,200 pence.

item.title: Metal Prices Slip Amid Dollar Strength
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were falling in early London trade, despite other commodities like oil rising, as dollar strength and macroeconomic weakness continued to pressure indexes.

item.title: Oil Gains After Saudi Arabia Goes It Alone With Oil Cuts
item.description: Oil prices rose about 2% in Europe after Saudi Arabia said it would unilaterally slash output by 1 million barrels a day.

item.title: Oil Prices Jump After Saudi Output Cut
item.description: Crude oil futures opened higher after Saudi Arabia said that it was cutting production on top of OPEC+ reductions.

item.title: Big American Companies Wonder: When Will China Bounce Back?
item.description: Big American companies in China were counting on a postpandemic boom to boost global revenue. For many, it isn’t happening.

item.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Climbs
item.description: Germany’s trade surplus rose to €18.4 billion in April, as exports ticked up 1.2% on month, beating expectations, a sign of increased foreign demand for German goods.

item.title: UBS to Close Credit Suisse Takeover as Early as Next Week
item.description: UBS Group said it expects to complete its acquisition of Credit Suisse Group and have the shares of the Swiss peer delisted as early as next week.

item.title: What Women Can Learn From Men About 'Me Time'
item.description: This summer, make more space in your life for the fun stuff.

item.title: A fresh incursion into Russia's Belgorod region by Ukraine-backed troops who said they seized territory and captured two Russian soldiers added to signs of vulnerability in Russia's defenses within its borders.
item.description: A fresh incursion into Russia’s Belgorod region by Ukraine-backed troops who said they seized territory and captured two Russian soldiers added to signs of vulnerability in Russia’s defenses within its borders.

item.title: Mexico's ruling party won the governorship in the country's most populous state, which has been a stronghold for the opposition.
item.description: Mexico’s ruling party won the governorship in the country’s most populous state, which has been a stronghold for the opposition.

item.title: Democrats expressed relief that the debt-ceiling fight with Republicans is over and a default was averted, but some are making plans to prevent a future standoff by trying to defuse the borrowing limit as a weapon.
item.description: Democrats expressed relief that the debt-ceiling fight with Republicans is over and a default was averted, but some are making plans to prevent a future standoff by trying to defuse the borrowing limit as a weapon.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: The Pentagon scrambled two F-16 jet fighters in response to a private Cessna plane, whose pilot was unresponsive, that flew over the nation's capital and then crashed in Virginia.
item.description: The Pentagon scrambled two F-16 jet fighters in response to a private Cessna plane, whose pilot was unresponsive, that flew over the nation’s capital and then crashed in Virginia.

item.title: Hollywood's major studios and streamers reached a tentative labor deal with the union representing directors, as a writers' strike rolls into its second month.
item.description: Hollywood’s major studios and streamers reached a tentative labor deal with the union representing directors, as a writers’ strike rolls into its second month.

item.title: Restaurant chain Cava Group is set to start marketing its IPO in a test of investor appetite for fast-growing companies that are still unprofitable.
item.description: Restaurant chain Cava Group is set to start marketing its IPO in a test of investor appetite for fast-growing companies that are still unprofitable.

item.title: Chuck Todd is stepping down as moderator of NBC News's "Meet the Press" in September and will be succeeded by chief White House correspondent Kristen Welker, the network said.
item.description: Chuck Todd is stepping down as moderator of NBC News’s “Meet the Press” in September and will be succeeded by chief White House correspondent Kristen Welker, the network said.

item.title: Hedge funds and other speculative investors have built up a big bet that the S&P 500 will decline, while preparing for a rally in the tech-focused Nasdaq-100.
item.description: Hedge funds and other speculative investors have built up a big bet that the S&P 500 will decline, while preparing for a rally in the tech-focused Nasdaq-100.

item.title: Saudi Arabia said it would cut 1 million barrels of oil a day as part of a deal between OPEC and its allies after one of the most contentious production meetings in recent years amid concerns over slowing global energy demand.
item.description: Saudi Arabia said it would cut 1 million barrels of oil a day as part of a deal between OPEC and its allies after one of the most contentious production meetings in recent years amid concerns over slowing global energy demand.
